snippet: Federal health officials recommended that hundreds of thousands of Americans at risk for AIDS take a daily pill shown to prevent infection with the virus that causes it.
abstract: Federal health officials recommend that hundreds of thousands of Americans at risk for AIDS take Truvada, daily pill that has been shown to prevent infection with the virus that causes AIDS; if broadly followed, advice could transform AIDS prevention in the United States--from reliance on condoms, which are effective but unpopular with many men, to a regimen that relies on an antiretroviral drug; Truvada costs $13,000 a year, and most insurers already cover it.
lead_paragraph: Federal health officials recommended that hundreds of thousands of Americans at risk for AIDS take a daily pill shown to prevent infection with the virus that causes it.
